page.title: 11 Astley Abbots Church
page.content:
The Church is{dedicated}to {St.Calixtus,}one of only two in the country! He was{Bishop of Rome}from {219}to{222 A.D.
The{first church}was built in{1138 and several{arches}and the{font}date from then. The Church now only has 3 {bells,two}cast in the reign of{Henry {VI.}The Church{Records,}dating from {1600}are kept at{The Shirehall, Shrewsbury.
The{"Maiden's Garland"}inside the Church is in memory of{Hannah Phillips who{drowned}whilst crossing the{River {Severn}by ferry at Astley Abbots on her {Wedding}Eve,in{1707.
In the Churchyard is a{cast iron {sundial}possibly made by Ironmaster, {Abraham Darby.
